hal::Adc Class Reference

Documentation

This class implements ADC device peripherals.

#include <sapi/hal.hpp>
int main(int argc, char * argv[]){
Adc adc(0); //create an instance of ADC to access port 0
u32 samples[16];
adc.init(); //initialize the ADC using the default configuration
adc.read(0, samples, 16*sizeof(u32)); //read 16 samples from channel 0
adc.read(1, samples, 16*sizeof(u32)); //read 16 samples from channel 1
adc.close(); //close the ADC
}

Member Function Documentation

int hal::Adc::init ( u32  o_flags,
u32  freq,
const adc_pin_assignment_t *  pin_assignment = 0 
)
inline

Opens the ADC port and sets the attributes as specified.

Parameters
o_flagsThe ADC flags (e.g. FLAG_SET_CONVERTER)
freqThe ADC frequency (set to 0 to use the maximum available)
pin_assignmentA pointer to the pin assignment data structure (0 to use default pin assignment)
Returns
Zero on success or less than zero for an error
int hal::Adc::set_attr ( u32  o_flags,
u32  freq,
const adc_pin_assignment_t *  pin_assignment = 0 
) const
inline

Sets the attributes of the ADC.

Parameters
o_flagsThe ADC flags (e.g. FLAG_SET_CONVERTER)
freqThe ADC frequency (set to 0 to use the maximum available)
pin_assignmentA pointer to the pin assignment data structure (0 to use default pin assignment)
Returns
Zero on success or less than zero for an error
